column5: Is it common for lodges in Ontario to put tax on Guide Fees and boat damage insurance ??Thanks

13% hst is the law of the land.Insurance is exempt, but loses its exempt status when passed on to a third party.Only way around it on the guide fee would be if the guide bills you direct and he has less than $30,000 a year in revenues.
That's correct. It isn't just common, it is illegal to not charge the tax. However, if you take a guide, often you are eligible for the HST rebate for Tour Operators.
Oh, and that rebate is 6.5% of the entire bill.
